extract_all.strategic_summary: Strong contractual position with clear performance breaches by opposing party. Multiple tactical opportunities available including summary judgment application and liquidated damages enforcement. Moderate financial exposure with high probability of favorable outcome.
key_citations: Pacific Carriers Ltd v BNP Paribas (2004) 218 CLR 451
Tramways Advertising Pty Ltd v Luna Park (NSW) Ltd (1938) 38 SR (NSW) 632

legal_principles.principle: Liquidated damages clauses are enforceable unless proven to be penalty
legal_principles.authority: Dunlop Pneumatic Tyre Co Ltd v New Garage & Motor Co Ltd [1915] AC 79

legal_principles.principle: Parties must comply with contractual dispute resolution procedures
legal_principles.authority: United Group Rail Services Ltd v Rail Corporation NSW (2009) 74 NSWLR 618

legal_principles.principle: Duty to mitigate losses applies but burden on defendant to prove failure
legal_principles.authority: Banco de Portugal v Waterlow & Sons Ltd [1932] AC 452

tactical_checklist: Serve formal breach notice under contract clause 15.1
Engage technical expert for performance assessment within 14 days
Quantify actual damages beyond liquidated damages
Research opposing party's financial capacity and insurance coverage
Prepare summary judgment application on clear contractual breaches
Document all mitigation efforts with supplier quotes
Secure project documentation and preserve electronic records
Assess prospects for interlocutory injunction against asset dissipation
extract_all.risk_assessment: Moderate-low litigation risk with 85% probability of favorable outcome. Primary risks include technical specification disputes (30% probability), contributory factor arguments (25% probability), and mitigation failure claims (40% probability). Financial exposure limited by strong contractual position and comprehensive documentation.
recommendations: Proceed with aggressive pre-trial strategy combining summary judgment with settlement negotiations
Commission engineering expert report within 45 days for technical assessment
Attempt mediation as required under contract while maintaining litigation pressure
File protective claim before limitation period to preserve rights
Focus discovery on opposing party's other projects for pattern evidence

citations: Pacific Carriers Ltd v BNP Paribas (2004) 218 CLR 451
Tramways Advertising Pty Ltd v Luna Park (NSW) Ltd (1938) 38 SR (NSW) 632
Dunlop Pneumatic Tyre Co Ltd v New Garage & Motor Co Ltd [1915] AC 79
United Group Rail Services Ltd v Rail Corporation NSW (2009) 74 NSWLR 618
Banco de Portugal v Waterlow & Sons Ltd [1932] AC 452

principles.principle: Liquidated damages clauses are enforceable unless proven to be penalty
principles.authority: Dunlop Pneumatic Tyre Co Ltd v New Garage & Motor Co Ltd [1915] AC 79

principles.principle: Parties must comply with contractual dispute resolution procedures before litigation
principles.authority: United Group Rail Services Ltd v Rail Corporation NSW (2009) 74 NSWLR 618

principles.principle: Duty to mitigate losses applies but burden on defendant to prove failure to mitigate
principles.authority: Banco de Portugal v Waterlow & Sons Ltd [1932] AC 452

principles.principle: Contract interpretation requires consideration of commercial purpose and context
principles.authority: Pacific Carriers Ltd v BNP Paribas (2004) 218 CLR 451

principles.principle: Breach must be material and substantial to justify termination
principles.authority: Tramways Advertising Pty Ltd v Luna Park (NSW) Ltd (1938) 38 SR (NSW) 632

principles.principle: Specific performance available where damages inadequate remedy
Misrepresentation requires false statement of existing fact inducing contract
principles.authority: Trade Practices Act 1974 (Cth) s 52 (now Competition and Consumer Act 2010)

checklist: Serve formal breach notice under contract clause 15.1 within 7 days
Engage technical expert for performance assessment within 14 days
Quantify actual damages beyond liquidated damages with supporting documentation
Research opposing party's financial capacity and insurance coverage
Secure and preserve all project documentation including electronic records
Document all mitigation efforts with alternative supplier quotes
Prepare summary judgment application on clear contractual breaches
Commission comprehensive engineering expert report within 45 days
Attempt mediation as required under contract clause 15.2
File protective claim before limitation period (October 2025)
Assess prospects for interlocutory injunction against asset dissipation
Focus discovery on opposing party's other projects for pattern evidence
Obtain industry standard evidence for technical requirements
Assemble expert evidence panel (engineering + quantum experts)
Develop witness statements from project manager and technical director
Calculate total legal costs budget ($93,000-$142,000 estimated)
Review opposing party's insurance policies and coverage limits
Prepare for expedited hearing if summary judgment application successful
Consider cross-claim potential and defensive strategies
Establish secure document review process for privileged materials

usage_notes.extract_all: Provides comprehensive strategic overview in structured JSON format. Ideal for initial case assessment and client reporting. Contains all key elements needed for strategic planning.
usage_notes.extract_citations: Clean list of legal authorities for court briefs, research databases, and citation checking. Ready for copy-paste into legal documents.
usage_notes.extract_principles: Structured legal principles with supporting authorities. Perfect for client advice letters, training materials, and settlement negotiations.
usage_notes.extract_checklist: Actionable tactical items in checkbox format. Essential for case preparation, file review, and ensuring comprehensive coverage of all strategic elements.

client_advice_workflow: 3. Use 'risk_assessment' from 'extract_all' for client risk discussion
